title: China Panel Democrat Pledges Bipartisan Approach Against Beijing
description: The top Democrat on the House China committee said he wants to keep a bipartisan approach, even as relations between the parties grow more fractious with the approach of the 2024 elections.

title: After $1.8 Billion of Outflows, Asia’s Worst-Performing Stock Market Is Set for Election Boost
description: Thai investors are pinning their hopes on the general election to revive stocks in Asia’s worst-performing market this year, as parties across the spectrum promise tens of billions of dollars in economic stimulus.

title: Trump Ally Sidney Powell Defeats One Ethics Probe, Now Faces a New One
description: Conservative attorney Sidney Powell recently prevailed against an ethics case in Texas tied to her failed legal fight to overturn the 2020 election results in favor of former President Donald Trump — even as she faces a new complaint in Michigan.

title: GOP Senator Cassidy Says Short-Term Debt Increase May Be Needed
description: Republican Senator Bill Cassidy portrayed a short-term boost in the US debt ceiling as a potential “cooling-off period” for partisan impasse as the nation barrels closer to catastrophic default.

title: Mexico Top Court Votes to Invalidate Part of Electoral Reform
description: Mexico’s Supreme Court annulled Monday part of the reform that reduced funding and personnel of the election regulator, known as the INE, on the grounds that the proper legislative process had not been followed by the country’s congress.

title: Biden, McCarthy Take First Steps in Debt Ceiling Dance
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House reporter Josh Wingrove sets the table for tomorrow’s debt ceiling meeting. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics.

title: Yellen Blasts Draconian Republican Cuts, Pushes Debt-Limit Hike
description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said Monday that the administration will be forced into making “decisions” on how to proceed if Congress doesn’t end up raising the federal debt limit in time.

title: Trump Ordered to Not Post Evidence in Hush-Money Case on Social Media
description: A New York judge barred Donald Trump from disseminating evidence from his criminal case on social media, restricting the former president’s ability to make public statements about charges alleging he directed hush-money payments to an adult film actress.

title: Canada Expels Chinese Envoy, Risking Retaliation in Growing Feud
description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s government has expelled a Chinese envoy from Canada, a move that could prompt economic or diplomatic backlash from President Xi Jinping.

title: Congo Sets New Due Dates for Bids on Eastern Region Oil Blocks
description: Democratic Republic of Congo’s oil ministry announced new due dates for bids on four oil blocks in its eastern region, including one that overlaps with a famous gorilla habitat.

title: McConnell Willing to Defy Trump on Senate Races After Midterm Flops
description: Senate Republican leader Mitch McConnell said Monday he won’t simply back candidates aligned with Donald Trump after several of them flopped and cost Republicans the majority in 2022.

title: Australia to Post First Budget Surplus in 15 Years on Cash Surge
description: Australia is headed for its first budget surplus since 2008 as windfall tax revenue from a fully employed economy and elevated commodity export prices combine to swell the government’s coffers.

title: House Republicans Threaten Blinken With Contempt Over Afghan Cable
description: The Republican-controlled House Foreign Affairs Committee threatened Secretary of State Antony Blinken with contempt of Congress if he doesn’t turn over a diplomatic cable related to the US withdrawal from Afghanistan.

title: Wall Street On Debt-Cap Alert as Biden, McCarthy Brace for Showdown
description: Treasury bills point to June default risks even as many other markets unperturbed.

title: Biden’s Oil-Reserve Withdrawals Spark Republican Demand for Audit
description: Top Republicans want a government watchdog to investigate the Biden administration’s management of the nation’s emergency oil reserves, arguing no credible plan exists to refill the cache that now stands at a 40-year low.

title: Pentagon Set to Scale Back Covid Era Fast-Track Contractor Funds
description: The Pentagon is scaling back a Covid-era program that sped up more than $8 billion in payments to top defense contractors, the department is set to announce later today.

title: Senegal Opposition Leader Faces Disqualification From 2024 Race
description: Senegal’s leading opposition politician could be disqualified from next year’s presidential election after a court sentenced him to six months suspended prison sentence after conviction for libel.

title: Mitch McConnell Warns He Has No ‘Secret Plan’ to Solve US Debt Impasse
description: Senate Republican leader Mitch McConnell warned he won’t come to President Joe Biden’s rescue on the debt limit by breaking a partisan deadlock as a catastrophic US default looms.

title: Southern Africa Bloc Agrees to Send Troops to Eastern Congo
description: The South African Development Community agreed to deploy troops to eastern Democratic Republic of Congo to help end violence in the region.

title: China Postpones Talks With German Finance Chief at Short Notice
description: China’s finance ministry postponed a meeting scheduled for Wednesday between German Finance Minister Christian Lindner and his counterpart in the government in Beijing.

title: Spain Pledges Aid to Help Younger Buyers Get on Housing Ladder
description: Spain’s government is offering to underwrite a chunk of the mortgages taken out by young Spaniards as part of a pre-election push to make owning a home more affordable.

title: Lula Taps Haddad’s Right-Hand Man for Central Bank Board
description: President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva will nominate Gabriel Galipolo to the board of Brazil’s central bank, Finance Minister Fernando Haddad told reporters Monday, sparking a selloff of local assets.

title: Trudeau Minister Sees Progress on Early-Stage India Trade Deal
description: India and Canada are getting closer to signing an early-stage trade agreement, a move that’s part of a larger Canadian strategy to diversify its Pacific trade and supply chains away from China.

title: Bid to Remove Warren Buffett as Chair of Berkshire Hathaway Rejected at Meeting
description: A long-shot bid by a conservative group to remove Warren Buffett as chair of Berkshire Hathaway Inc. failed by a wide margin at the company’s annual shareholder meeting in Omaha on Saturday.

title: EU Cancels Israel Event Rather Than Let Far-Right Minister Speak
description: The European Union canceled a diplomatic reception in Tel Aviv to protest the Israeli government’s decision to send a far-right cabinet minister to address the event.

title: Chilean Assets Gain as Political Right Takes Over Control of Constitution Rewrite Process
description: Chilean assets gained Monday after opposition conservatives dealt a significant blow to the progressive agenda of President Gabriel Boric.

title: EU Targets Russian Oil Transfers At Sea in Sanctions Enforcement
description: The European Union proposed prohibiting access to its ports for vessels that attempt to circumvent sanctions on Russian oil as it seeks to deter transport of its crude and products below the price caps set by the Group of Seven nations.

title: Germany’s Off-Budget Funds Hurt Financial Credibility, OECD Says
Kamala Harris Is Finding Her Stride as Team Biden’s Voice to Black Voters
description: Kamala Harris began finding her footing last year with a rousing, impromptu eulogy for a Black matriarch that drew a mostly African-American audience to its feet — a task she must now replicate on a wide scale to secure President Joe Biden’s reelection.

title: Meta May End Facebook, Instagram News Content in Canada Over Act
description: Meta Platforms Inc. said it would end news content on Facebook and Instagram in Canada if lawmakers there pass legislation that would force social-networking platforms to pay media publishers to feature their work.

title: Chile Inflation Slides Below 10% for First Time Since 2022, Giving the Central Bank Some Relief
description: Chile’s annual inflation eased back to single digits for the first time since March 2022, offering some relief to policymakers as they hold the benchmark interest rate at the highest in over two decades.

title: Biden, McCarthy Head Into Showdown as Debt Limit Crisis Nears
description: Joe Biden and Kevin McCarthy have arrived at a crucial moment in their debt ceiling fight — a meeting that risks cementing their standoff rather than yielding a breakthrough in a crisis already unnerving markets.

title: Ukraine Should Get Concrete Path to Join NATO, Estonia Says
description: NATO allies need to spell out the concrete steps for Ukraine to become a member of the military alliance and move beyond repeating the standing position that it’s welcome to join the bloc, according to Estonia’s top diplomat.

title: EU Proposes Curbs on Several Chinese Firms for Aiding Russia
description: The European Union has proposed extending strict trade restrictions to several Chinese companies for the first time as it cracks down on firms supplying Russia with banned goods and technologies that have aided its war machine in Ukraine.

title: Poland Ruling Party Sees Support Slip Before Vote, Poll Shows
description: Poland’s ruling party saw a slide in support and may struggle to hold on to power after an election expected in October, a poll showed.

title: The Question of Age Dogs Biden’s Reelection Bid
description: It’s the niggling question Joe Biden bats away, but one that keeps coming back now that the 80-year-old has announced he’s running again for the presidency: his age.

title: India Monitored Chinese Ships During Drill in South China Sea
description: India monitored several Chinese ships that appeared in a portion of the South China Sea where a flotilla of Southeast Asian nations’ warships were engaged in military drills, according to a government official.

title: Biden Administration Tamps Down Talk of US-China Decoupling
description: Recent speeches by Yellen and Sullivan seek to reassure allies economic conflict between the two superpowers can be contained.

title: China’s New Foreign Minister Meets US Envoy for First Time
description: Chinese Foreign Minister Qin Gang met US Ambassador Nicholas Burns in the highest-level meeting in weeks between the world’s biggest economies, signaling that Beijing may soon allow more senior-level discussions after rebuffing requests from the Biden administration.

title: Violence Kills at Least 37 in India’s Border State With Myanmar
description: At least 37 people have been killed in clashes over access to government affirmative action benefits in India’s northeastern Manipur state but the worst of the violence appears to have been contained, local officials said.

title: Ukraine Latest: Kyiv Downs 35 Drones, Missiles Hit Odesa Region
description: Russia attacked the Kyiv region with 35 Iranian-made Shahed drones overnight, the Ukrainian Air Force said on Telegram. All the drones, which came from the Bryansk region of Russia, were shot down by air defense. The Odesa region was attacked overnight by missiles.

title: China Flags Supply Chains, Population as Top Policy Priorities
description: China is expected to roll out new policies to protect supply chains and boost its birth rate, after President Xi Jinping led a high-profile meeting that established these areas as top economic priorities.

title: Japan PM Applauds Trust With South Korea After Landmark Summit
description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida finished a landmark visit to Seoul with pledges to seek cooperation on high-tech goods and commitments on a renewed reliance between the two countries who are key to US security policies.

title: Phasing Out Fossil Fuels Hasn’t Worked. Europe Has a New Idea for COP28
description: Expecting resistance to emissions cuts in Dubai, some climate hawks have started focusing on a global goal for renewables.

title: Rampant Corruption at Energy Provider Drags Down South Africa
description: Coal mafias, graft and industrial sabotage are pushing South Africa’s power monopoly closer to collapse

title: EU Plans Sanctions on China Companies Aiding Russia, FT Says
description: The European Commission has proposed sanctions on seven Chinese companies accused of selling equipment that could be used in weapons for Russia’s war, the Financial Times reports.

title: China Limits Data After US Research Spurred Alarm, WSJ Says
description: Beijing curtailed access by overseas firms to Chinese data sources at least in part because of a series of reports written by US research institutions that alarmed officials, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing people with knowledge of the matter.

title: Australia's Treasurer on Federal Budget, China Relations
description: Australian Treasurer Jim Chalmers will hand down the government’s first full-year Budget on Tuesday May 9.  Ahead of his speech, Bloomberg News' Ben Westcott sat down with the Treasurer in Canberra to discuss what to expect, Australia's economy and the latest on Australia-China relations. (Source: Bloomberg)
